titles.title: To permit any individual who has attained 62 years of age to engage in recreational fishing in navigable waters in any State without obtaining a license.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries Conservation, Wildlife and Oceans.

bill.summary: 3/1/2000--Introduced. Allows individuals who attain 62 years of age, without obtaining a license, permit, or other authorization, to engage in recreational fishing in any State under the same conditions and restrictions that apply under the State laws to an individual who holds such license, permit, or other authorization.
